page.title: 20WADEBRIDGE_THE FLOODS
page.content: Wadebridge is built along the banks of the{River Camel}so there is always the likelihood of flooding. In recent years ther have been 3 serious floods. In{1965}there was a{cloudburst}and{125 {mm}of rain fell in{3.5 hours}.Water covered the roofs of cars on{The Platt and the firemen had to use boats.{St. {Breock Church}suffered serious flooding. In{1976}after continuous heavy rain a{ {slurry pit}at{Dunveth Farm}collapsed and a flood of slurry rushed down{ {Whiterock Road}and{Molesworth Street} and formed a huge lake by{The Platt.} In{1984}extremely high tides caused only minor flooding. On the morning of Sunday{7th April}a combination of a spring tide heavy rain and strong winds caused extensive flooding of the {Eddystone Road Area, The Platt}and the {Playing Fields}.
